guide.name: Upload a campaign
guide.description: How to upload your campaigns to Ad Auction Dashboard

steps.step: Make sure you have your log files available. You should have a log file for clicks, impressions and server.

link.linkText: Click here to read more about your log files

steps.step: Select "Upload Campaign" from the main menu
Enter your campaign's name
Upload each of your log files by clicking on the labelled boxes
Hit "Submit"
If successful, you will be directed back to the main menu
If unsuccessful, refer to the error message on screen and try again

section.sectionText: This log file is for all instances in which an ad was clicked on by a user. For each click we know the time, what user clicked on it, and how much that click costed.

Each impression is someone viewing your ad regardless of whether they interact with it. For each impression we know the time and that user's gender (Male/Female), age bracket, income (Low/Medium/High), the context in which they saw the ad (Blog, News, etc.), and how much that impression cost.

This log file is used to track a user's interactions after clicking on an ad. For each instance we can see the time in which they entered and exited the website, how many pages they viewed and whether a user acts on the ad (e.g.by buying a product)

guide.name: Viewing your campaigns
guide.description: See how your ad campaign performed

steps.step: Make sure you have uploaded your campaign

link.linkText: Click here to read about uploading campaigns

steps.step: Select "Load Campaign" on the main menu
Select your campaign from the list
Once your campaign has finished loading you will be directed to the campaign page
You can change which metric to view for your campaign from the menu on the left

link.linkText: Click here to read about different metrics

steps.step: You can change the type of graph to look at through the dropdown menu in the top right

link.linkText: Click here to read about graph types

steps.step: You can also apply filters to your dataset

link.linkText: Click here to read about using filters

steps.step: You can include other campaigns and "snapshot" your current settings

link.linkText: Click here to read about including other campaigns

guide.name: Adding Filters
guide.description: How to add filters to your loaded campaign

steps.step: Select "Load Campaign" from the main menu
Select the campaign you wish to load into the system
Select the filters tab in the bottom left
Choose the filters you want to apply
E.g. Unchecking the boxes for "Male" and "High" and picking a "Before" date
An updated graph will now be displayed

guide.name: Change between metrics
guide.description: How to change between metrics for your loaded campaign

steps.step: Select "Load Campaign" from the main menu
Select the campaign you wish to load into the system
Select the metrics tab in the bottom left
Choose the metrics you wish to look at (E.g. "Number of Impressions" or "Number of Clicks")
An updated graph will now be displayed

guide.name: Types of graph
guide.description: How to change type of graph for your loaded campaign

steps.step: Select "Load Campaign" from the main menu
Select the campaign you wish to load into the system
Select the dropdown button in the top right
Choose the between the available graphs (E.g. "Cumulative" or "Trend")
An updated graph will now be displayed

section.sectionText: A cumulative graph will show how your ad campaign fared using all the data from the beginning of the campaign to the time of each point display on the graph. This is useful to see the campaign in its entirety for each metric.

A trend graph shows the corresponding metric calculated over a given period of time, only accounting for the data from the last point in time to the current point. This is useful to see how you campaign fared on individual time periods.
A histogram is used to show the distribution of certain metrics.

guide.name: Show the campaign dashboard
guide.description: How to show the dashboard of the campaign

steps.step: Open the campaign page of one campaign
Click the Dashboard button on the top right
The dashboard of the campaign will be shown

guide.name: Changing Themes
guide.description: How to change colour scheme of Ad Auction Dashboard

steps.step: Select "Settings" from the main menu
Select the "Appearance" on the side menu of the setting page
Select a theme from the dropdown menu
Ad Auction Dashboard will update

guide.name: Editing Campaign
guide.description: How to change the data of one campaign

steps.step: Enter the edit page from the settings page, the campaign page or the upload campaign page
Enter the new campaign name or choose the csv file that needs to be edited
Click the Submit button when the changes are done
Click the cancel button if you don't want to do these changes
Click the delete button to delete this campaign

section.sectionText: Click the edit button for each campaign on the campaign list.
Click the Edit button on the top right.

section.sectionName: Editing from the upload campaign page
section.sectionText: Click the toothed gear symbol for each campaign

steps.step: Enter the edit page
Click the red delete campaigns button
Another way is Enter the campaign list in the settings page and click the delete button

guide.name: Change campaign page appearance
guide.description: How to change the appearance of the campaign page

steps.step: Enter the settings page
Click the campaign list button on the side menu
Find the campaign options section
Choose the default metric and the points per unit of time
